did.abstract: This is Series A, Part 1 of the Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters records.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters (BSCP) was, in 1925, the first labor organization led by blacks to receive a charter in the American Federation of Labor (AFL). It merged in 1978 with the Brotherhood of Railway and Airline Clerks (BRAC), now known as the Transportation Communications International Union.
